meanings.definition: Capable of being substituted for one another.
meanings.sent1: These two ingredients are intersubstitutable in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: In this game, players have intersubstitutable roles.
meanings.sent3: The intersubstitutable hats at the party caused confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her intersubstitutable skills in different languages amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The intersubstitutable keys fit multiple locks perfectly.

meanings.definition: Able to be interchanged or replaced.
meanings.sent1: The intersubstitutable parts of the machine make repairs easy.
meanings.sent2: These batteries are intersubstitutable in the remote control.
meanings.sent3: His intersubstitutable excuses for being late were creative.
meanings.sent4: The intersubstitutable actors in the play brought fresh perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The intersubstitutable colors of the paint palette allowed for endless combinations.
